attributes.action: Change the current Tax Relief rules to allow apprentice tradesmen to claim tax relief on tools they purchase for their job
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under current taxation rules, it is possible to claim some tax relief on replacement tools purchased for work.  However, new tools cannot be claimed for by employees or apprentices.

If I was self-employed, and maybe earning £20-£30 per hour, I believe I would be able to claim tax back on all my tools purchased, even new ones.  However, as an apprentice building up a collection of my own tools (my employers pay no contribution) I am purchasing more tools on my £4.45 p/h minimum wage than an established self-employed person would normally be expected to, but I am not allowed to claim any tax relief on these tools beyond the £70 p/a that everyone gets.  This represents a gross imbalance in the tax system, and I appeal to the PM and his Chancellor to address this imbalance promptly.
